cohort: Multiple Myeloma, RRMM, by Payer Regimen Coverage (2024–2025)
summary: Significant variation in use of high-margin regimens based on payer. Medicare patients receive Dara-based regimens 52% of the time vs. only 18% for Commercial Payer B.

financial_impact.math: $325,000/year = 15% utilization gap × 35 patients × $62,000 adjusted margin difference

clinical_impact.description: Addressing payer-specific barriers could improve access to optimal regimens for all patients.

metrics.description: Potential PFS improvement with optimized regimen selection
Improvement in treatment equity across payer types
Reduction in authorization denials with proactive approach
Reduction in patient out-of-pocket costs with financial counseling

peer_comparison.description: Top RRMM practices achieve 38%+ Dara-based regimen utilization for Commercial B patients vs. your 18%. Successful practices employ dedicated prior authorization specialists.

action_steps.text: Implement financial navigation program for self-pay patients
Analyze Commercial B and C authorization requirements
Implement patient assistance program enrollment process
Create appeals process for regimen denials

suggestions.text: Negotiate improved regimen coverage with Commercial B and C
Share successful authorization strategies across team
